info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:16AM CDT until April 8 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Nashville TN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Nashville TN has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Tennessee...
Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County.
For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Duck River near Hurricane Mills.
* WHEN...From this morning to Tuesday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Agricultural land, other low lying areas, and access points along the river from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd begin to flood. Portions of Tumbling Creek Rd east of Highway 13 begin to flood. At 22.0 feet, Portions of Tumbling Creek Road east of Highway 13 are flooded to a depth of 2 feet and may be impassable.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 19.9 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued late tonight at 230 AM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO TUESDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
